alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 8:42PM EDT until August 10 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following county, Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 842 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. This is an area that had seen heavy rain earlier in the day. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to up to 1 inch is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jeffersontown, Middletown, Douglass Hills, Anchorage, Worthington Hills, Woodland Hills, Fincastle, Fisherville, Routt and Thixton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
